description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cpavt","text":"Giving a retracted article, we present a step-by-step methodology for gathering the raw-data of the documents which have cited such article (starting from the date of its publication) and annotating the metadata and features for such citing entities. The external services used for our purpose are all free and open. The methodology uses three external services: (a) OpenCitations COCI (http://opencitations.net/index/coci, used to retrieve citation data), (b) RetractionWatch database (http://retractiondatabase.org, used to retrieve information of retracted articles), and (c) SCImago (https://www.scimagojr.com/, to retrieve subject areas and subject categories of publications). The methodology is divided into five steps: (1) identifying and retrieving the citing entities, (2) retrieving the citing entities characteristics, (3) classifying the citing entities according to subject areas and subject categories, (4) extracting textual values from the citing entities, and (5) annotating the in-text citations characteristics. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":387,"length":35},{"key":1,"offset":487,"length":29},{"key":2,"offset":588,"length":26}],"data":[]},{"key":"dfbb4","text":"The application of this methodology produces a dataset containing all the citing entities and their annotated data/features. Starting from an empty dataset, each step of the methodology (from 1 to 5) enriches it with new variables.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"53A80F303A1111EB8029C562FCCEECA4","url":"http://opencitations.net/index/coci"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"626D57003A1111EB8029C562FCCEECA4","url":"http://retractiondatabase.org"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"6B4A52603A1111EB8029C562FCCEECA4","url":"https://www.scimagojr.com/"}}}}
guidelines:
{"blocks":[{"key":"34m13","text":"The aim of this methodology is to build a dataset containing the raw-data and the characteristics of the entities which have cited an examined retracted article. The methodology is divided into five steps which are summarized in the table below. For each step (table row) we mention its title (i.e. "Step" column), give a brief description (i.e. "Description" column), specify the inputs needed (i.e. "Input") and show the expected output (i.e. "Output" column). The output of each step associates new data/features to the gathered citing entities. Technically, it extends the final dataset with new variables (columns).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2t4d2","text":"    Phase   Description   Input   Output (new dataset attributes)     1) Identifying and retrieving the resources   Identifying the list of entities citing the retracted article and annotating there main attributes   Retracted article DOI   1.1) DOI 1.2) year of publication 1.3) titleÂ  1.4) source id (ISSN/ISBN)Â  1.5) source title     2) Annotating the citing entities characteristics   Annotating whether the citing entities are/arenât retracted   Citing entities DOIs   2.1) is retracted?     3) Classifying the citingÂ entitiesÂ into subjects of study   Classifying the citing entities macro subjects and specific areas of study following the SCImago classification   Citing entities ISSN/ISBN values   3.1) subjectÂ  3.2) area     3) Extracting textual values from the citing entities   Extracting the citing entities abstracts and the in-text citation/s pointer, section of occurrence, and context Â    Citing entities DOIs   4.1) abstract 4.2) in-text citation/s section 4.3) in-text citation/s context 4.4) in-text citation/s pointer     5) Annotating the in-text citations characteristics   Annotating for each captured in-text citation its intent and sentiment, and specifying whether at least one of the in-text citation/s mentions the retraction notice   Citing entities in-text citations context   5.1) citation/s intent 5.2) sentiment/s 5.3) retraction mentioned?    ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1378}],"data":[]},{"key":"be1f7","text":"All the related materials of this methodology are maintained in the dedicated Git repository at https://github.com/ivanhb/cits-ret-method. {"blocks":[{"key":"5rike","text":"Now we need to get the list of the entities which have cited the retracted article. We will query the COCI dataset (https://opencitations.net/index/coci). This dataset contains details of all the citations that are specified by the open references to DOI-identified works present in Crossref (https://www.crossref.org/). These attributes are available in the COCI datasets.
